title: Access Groups
description: Access Groups allow you to define a set of users to which an application policy can be applied. You can reuse Access groups to quickly create policies that apply to the same set of users

name.description: The name of the group. Only used in the UI.

include.description: The include policy works like an OR logical operator. The user must satisfy one of the rules in includes.

items.description: Rule configuration. Use the rule type in the top level of the rule configuration object. In the example, the rule type is email and it wraps the email configuration.

everyone.description: The everyone rule uses an empty object for the configuration. This will allow any user to reach the path of the application without authentication.

ip.description: An IPv4 or IPv6 CIDR block.

oneOf.title: Access IP List Rule
oneOf.description: Match an IP from a list.

id.description: The ID of a previously created IP List.
The ID of a previously created Access Group.
The ID of an Azure group.

connection_id.description: The ID of your Azure identity provider.
The ID of your Github identity provider.
The ID of your GSuite identity provider.
The ID of your ID of your Okta identity provider.

everyone.description: The everyone rule uses an empty object for the configuration. This will allow any user to reach the path of the application without authentication.

ip.description: An IPv4 or IPv6 CIDR block.

id.description: The ID of a previously created Access Group.
The ID of an Azure group.

connection_id.description: The ID of your Azure identity provider.
The ID of your Github identity provider.

The ID of your ID of your Okta identity provider.

ip_list_rule.description: Match an IP from a list.
